case_title: In The Matter Of: Messrs Ayaz Textile Mills Limited vs N/A
reference_no_or_id: Show-Cause Notice No. EMD/Enf-II/215/2004, dated 21st February, 2005
case_number: Show-Cause Notice No. EMD/Enf-II/215/2004, dated 21st February, 2005
court: Appellate Bench of Securities and Exchange Commission of Pakistan

accussed_details.name: Ayaz Durrani
allegation: Non-holding of AGM for year ending September 30, 2004
Non-preparation and circulation of annual accounts
Non-submission of quarterly accounts since June 30, 2003 to December 31, 2004

complaint_summary: Failure to hold AGM for the year ending September 30, 2004, as required under Section 158(1) of the Companies Ordinance, 1984.
investigation_summary: Show-cause notice issued on February 21, 2005. No reply received initially. Hearing fixed for March 21, 2005, and re-fixed for April 18, 2005. Written reply submitted by Chief Executive Ayaz Durrani citing financial crisis and closure of operations.
judgment_summary: The default in holding AGM and preparing annual accounts was established under Section 158(4) of the Companies Ordinance, 1984. A fine of Rs. 20,000 was imposed on the Chief Executive, Ayaz Durrani, and other directors were reprimanded to ensure future compliance.
punishment: Fine of Rs. 20,000 imposed on Chief Executive Ayaz Durrani. Other directors reprimanded.
legal_arguments: Company closure due to financial crisis cited as reason for default.
Management requested leniency and time to comply with legal requirements.
Past defaults noted, including non-holding of AGM for year ending September 30, 2003.
assets: Fixed assets sold by Habib Bank Limited

witness_statement.Mazhar Hussain: Reiterated arguments of Chief Executive, informed about financial crisis, closure of operations, and liquidation arrangements.

key_issues: Failure to prepare and circulate annual accounts

legal_terms.Liquidation: Process of winding up a company

words_and_phrases.Default: Failure to fulfill a legal obligation
words_and_phrases.Lenient View: Consideration of mitigating circumstances to reduce penalties

summary_vector_notes: Case involves non-compliance with AGM requirements under Companies Ordinance, 1984. Financial crisis and liquidation cited as reasons for default. Judgment imposes Rs. 20,000 fine on Chief Executive and reprimands other directors.

facts.default_reason: Company closure due to financial losses

payment_instructions.personal_payment: Fine to be paid from personal resources

notes.financial_crisis_consideration: Lenient view taken due to financial crisis and liquidation intent
